events.name: Data Science in Financial Services
events.description: We have interesting talks lined up: 1) Bitcoin meets Big Data by Vihang Patel, CTO of Dragon Wealth Asia (offers the world’s first ‘marketing in a box’ designed specifically for financial advisors to connect more easily and more often to new and current investors)  2) Making banking joyful through design & insights – Where data science meets design thinking by Jurgen Meerschaege, SVP Head Business Analytics & Decision Support at DBS 3) The Big Data Ready Bank  by Leonard Vijay Richard, Vice President - Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence at DBS The talks will be followed by a panel discussion moderated by Nirmal Palaparthi, Analytics Expert and Consultant. About the speakers:  Vihang Patel is the CTO of Dragon Wealth Asia, focused on building the Product and Technology to drive a new class of Client experience in Wealth Management. Vihang has over 13 years of entrepreneurial, corporate and management consulting experience in South-East Asia, India, Middle East and Europe with experience across multiple verticals including Financial Services, Retail, Hospitality and Media with a passion for Technology-centric businesses and disruptive innovation. Vihang founded Avagam with a simple mission to enable enterprises derive higher value through easy to use data analytics, and was acquired by Crayon Data in 2012.  Jurgen Meerschaege heads the analytics team within the DBS Improvement Team. Part of the Insights & Design practice, the business analytics and decision support team provides deep customer experience understanding to the many improvement initiatives that DBS undertakes. In addition, Jurgen drives the advanced analytics agenda and portfolio for Operations. Prior to that, Jurgen was the global head of financial planning & analysis at Capco in New York. Jurgen has 20 years experience in strategic business planning, analytics and change management, gained across Europe, North America and Asia. Jurgen holds an Economics degree and a Master’s in Accounting from EHSAL in Belgium.  Leonard Vijay Richard is a Business Intelligence and advanced analytics professional. He championed the DBS Hadoop initiative and led their implementation of the Data Lake. He also was the lead data modeller for the novel Teradata SMBB implementation at DBS. With 15 years in the DWBI world, he is passionate about everything data. He has worn various leadership and strategic hats and is a thought leader, driving Banking and Financial Industry technology solutions, innovations and change: BigData COE lead - DBS, COO - First Investment Bank, Solution Design Lead - Wipro  Nirmal Palaparthi co-founded Fractal Analytics, a global analytics firm that helps Fortune 500 companies gain competitive advantage through deep understanding of consumers and better data driven decisions. --------------------------------------------------------------------- Special thanks to our host The HUB, Singapore.  The Hub Singapore is Singapore’s largest community of start-ups and impact entrepreneurs. We are a coworking space in the heart of Singapore and also offer mentorship, incubation, workshops, events, marketing support and a dedicated corporate engagement program.

events.name: ProductTank: Prioritization
events.description:
MEETUP THEME: PRIORITIZATION Prioritization is arguably the most important aspect of Product Management, and we’re opening a chapter of ProductTank Singapore with this theme. We will explore the aspects of prioritization of products and features from two different angles: business- and user-centric. 


SPEAKERS AND TALKS #1 Graham Kennedy: "We are all revenue officers: Determining product value for executive stakeholders." Graham's spent over 10 years building and leading cross-functional product teams. Currently, he is the Head of Product at TradeGecko. He previously led Product at Clio, a leading North American SaaS and mobile offering for legal practice management. He enjoys sharing and learning about strategic product management: pricing, ROI, customer acquisition, and finding product/market fit. 



#2 Coleman Yee: "Prioritising your product with UX-tinted glasses" Coleman is a UX consultant who has worked with agencies, startups, and big, hairy organizations on apps, websites, and intranets that are far too complicated. When it comes to writing his own bio, he takes things too seriously. 



AGENDA 18:45 - Registration starts. 19:10 - Registration ends. 19:15 - 19:45 - First speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 19:45 - 20:00 - Break! 20:00 - 20:30 - Second speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 20:30 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. Notes:  • Exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • Registration closes at 23:59 on Monday, April 25.

events.name: Bi-Monthly BTC in SG Meetup - With Simon Dixon
events.description: Luck would have it Simon Dixon is in town this week and will be presenting on what he's up to with BnkToTheFuture.com and bitcoin investments. https://www.linkedin.com/in/simondixonbankingreform Location will be at Microsoft Singapore. Please check in the front desk downstairs and come up to the 22dn floor.  The door at the 22nd floor is closed, so please come before 7pm so we don't have to keep running back and forth to let you in! Thanks, David
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, 22nd Floor, One Marina Boulevard, NTUC Cebtre

events.name: Maker Faire 2016 Meetup!
events.description:
Calling all Makers! This year's Maker Faire is right around the corner! If you would like to set up a booth for the Maker Faire or would like to know how you can join in the fun, sign up for this Makers Meetup!

We invite everyone to come for this meet-up to share ideas and co-design to make this Maker Faire booth the best one yet!

Maker Faire 2016 Meet up!
Date: 27 April, Wednesday, 7pm
Venue: The Prototyping Lab @ NDC

Maker Faire will be happening on the 25th and 26th of June at the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) 
8 Somapah Road, Singapore 487372

events.name: Hackware v1.7: Electronic design software Special
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Talks for this meetup:

1. (10min) Fritzing - Sayanee Basu
2. (20min) Quick Start to CadSoft EAGLE - Yeo Kheng Meng
3. (20min) KiCAD - Baoshi Zhu
4. (20min) Upverter - Shanmugam Mpl
5. (5min) Morse Code Kit - Gabriel J Perumal

6. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

7. Show and Tell

Talks : ~20mins
Talks typically include side projects of speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things and much more. We want to hear about an electronics project that you already implemented at home or anywhere.

Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Lightning talks are short electronics demo that are working or even incomplete based on open source hardware and software. We wanna see all your fried chips and electronics to be fixed. Nothing has to be perfect - we are all learning. Bring them! 
(No product videos or proprietery technology.)

Announcements: ~1min
Announcement can be done by anyone looking to get hired or hire someone. Talk about your project / company and tell us who you are looking for.

Show and Tell: ~free and easy 
Bring your completed / uncompleted hardware projects and ask for feedback and share your learnings.

Venue sponsored by the wonderful folks at Ground-Up Initiative (GUI)

events.name: Going Cloud-Native [http://bit.ly/1Pq2LAL]
events.description: Register at:http://bit.ly/1Pq2LAL [online meetup - free event]The promise of containerization is clear: Although it enables agile application development, containerization’s ultimate payoff is realized during production deployment.Register at: To realize the benefits, the necessary infrastructure needs to be in place - and building this infrastructure can be a time consuming and manual process. We will answer questions you may have about Navops, Docker, and Kubernetes. Interested, but can't attend? Register anyway and we'll send you the recording.
